name: Lazarus Group ATT&CK Matrix (v14)
description: ATT&CK Layer describing Lazarus Group's techniques.

techniques.comment: The group uses compromised remote desktop protocol (RDP) credentials to gain initial access.
The group uses stolen credentials along with RDP to enable lateral movement within the targeted system.
The group uses QuasarRAT, customized and dubbed as 'PurpleInk', as a Remote Access Tool (RAT). They also use the malware loaders 'InkBox' and 'InkLoader'.
The group uses an open-source remote management tool, MeshAgent, and Secure Socket Funneling (SSF) as part of its infrastructure for persistence.
The group executes commands via the command-line interface to create and start services.
PurpleInk is also used to gather system information about the infected host using WMI queries.
The group employs encryption for stealing data.
Group uses compromised RDP credentials to gain access.
The group uses custom command and control protocols to maintain communication with their remote servers.

title: Lazarus Group ATT&CK Matrix (v14)
